quizzes.title: AI Fundamentals Quiz
quizzes.description: Test your understanding of basic AI concepts, history, and applications covered in the introduction chapter.

questionData.question: What event is considered the official birth of Artificial Intelligence as a research field?
options: The release of the first iPhone
questionData.explanation: The Dartmouth Conference brought together pioneers like John McCarthy and Marvin Minsky, marking AI’s beginning as an academic field.

questionData.question: Which of the following is an example of Narrow AI?
options: A system that can think like a human in any situation
A future AI that surpasses human intelligence
A self-aware robot from science fiction
questionData.explanation: Narrow AI is designed for specific tasks. Chatbots are a classic case: they handle one well-defined job but lack general intelligence.

questionData.question: Why did movies like *2001: A Space Odyssey* or *Star Wars* influence public views of AI?
options: They popularized the idea of intelligent machines
questionData.explanation: Before AI was widely used, films shaped public imagination with friendly robots and scary supercomputers.

questionData.question: Which of these is a limitation of today’s AI?
questionData.explanation: Modern AI can recognize patterns but struggles with everyday logic humans take for granted.

questionData.question: When you unlock your phone with Face ID, which type of AI are you using?
questionData.explanation: Face ID uses computer vision, an AI method that lets machines interpret and understand visual information.

quizzes.title: Machine Learning Concepts Quiz
quizzes.description: Evaluate your knowledge of ML algorithms, supervised and unsupervised learning methods from chapter 2.

questionData.question: What is the key difference between traditional programming and machine learning?
options: ML systems learn patterns from data instead of following fixed rules
Traditional programming always makes fewer mistakes
ML cannot be used for predictions
questionData.explanation: Traditional programming is rule-based. ML discovers rules by analyzing examples in data.

questionData.question: Which of the following best describes supervised learning?
options: The model groups data without labels
The model learns by rewards and penalties
The model is trained on labeled input-output pairs
The model works without any training data
questionData.explanation: Supervised learning uses labeled datasets to train models, like email spam filters that learn from examples of 'spam' and 'not spam'.

questionData.question: A company groups customers based on their shopping behavior without using labels. Which ML approach is this?
questionData.explanation: Unsupervised learning finds hidden patterns in unlabeled data, like clustering customers into groups.

questionData.question: Which algorithm is most suitable for predicting the price of a house based on its size and location?
questionData.explanation: Linear Regression predicts continuous numerical values such as prices or temperatures.

questionData.question: Why is the phrase 'Garbage in, garbage out' important in machine learning?
options: ML systems can work without data
Bad data leads to poor models
It refers to hardware issues in AI
It means ML models cannot learn patterns
questionData.explanation: ML performance depends on the quality of training data. Biased or messy input will produce weak models.

quizzes.title: Neural Networks Deep Dive Quiz
quizzes.description: Challenge yourself with neural network architectures and deep learning concepts from chapter 3.

questionData.question: What is the key difference between deep learning and traditional machine learning?
options: Deep learning automatically extracts features from raw data
Deep learning is only used for robots
questionData.explanation: Unlike traditional ML, deep learning can learn complex features directly from data using neural networks.

questionData.question: Which biological system inspired the design of neural networks?
questionData.explanation: Artificial neural networks are inspired by the structure of neurons and their connections in the brain.

questionData.question: What is the main role of the hidden layers in a neural network?
options: To add noise to the data
To transform inputs into progressively more abstract features
questionData.explanation: Hidden layers capture complex patterns by building higher-level representations of the data.

questionData.question: Which activation function is most commonly used in hidden layers today?
questionData.explanation: ReLU is computationally efficient and helps prevent the vanishing gradient problem.

questionData.question: Why is a large dataset important for training deep learning models?
options: Because deep learning models have many parameters that need lots of examples to train
Because large datasets make training faster
Because deep learning doesn’t work with images
Because data quality doesn’t matter in deep learning
questionData.explanation: With millions of parameters, deep networks need large datasets to avoid overfitting and learn effectively.

quizzes.title: Practical AI Applications Quiz
quizzes.description: Apply your knowledge to real-world AI scenarios and case studies from chapter 4.

questionData.question: What is the primary goal of Natural Language Processing?
options: To translate human languages into binary code
To enable machines to understand, interpret, and generate human language
questionData.explanation: NLP bridges the gap between human language and computer understanding.

questionData.question: Which technique is used to represent words as vectors in NLP?
questionData.explanation: Word embeddings capture semantic meaning by placing words in a continuous vector space.

questionData.question: Which NLP task powers voice assistants like Siri or Alexa?
questionData.explanation: Voice assistants use speech recognition to convert spoken words into text and commands.

questionData.question: Which deep learning model architecture revolutionized NLP starting in 2017?
questionData.explanation: Transformers enabled powerful models like GPT and BERT, significantly advancing NLP tasks.

questionData.question: When analyzing tweets to detect positive or negative tone, which NLP technique is being applied?
questionData.explanation: Sentiment analysis identifies emotional tone in text, often applied to social media posts.

quizzes.title: Final Comprehensive Assessment
quizzes.description: Comprehensive evaluation covering all course topics and advanced problem-solving scenarios.

questionData.question: Which AI application is commonly used in healthcare today?
options: Medical image analysis for disease detection
questionData.explanation: AI helps radiologists detect diseases like cancer by analyzing medical images.

questionData.question: Which industry uses recommendation systems most heavily?
options: Entertainment platforms like Netflix and Spotify
questionData.explanation: Recommendation systems suggest movies, music, and products based on user preferences.

questionData.question: What role does AI play in self-driving cars?
options: Detecting objects and making driving decisions
questionData.explanation: Computer vision and decision-making algorithms enable cars to navigate safely.

questionData.question: Which AI-powered technology is used by financial institutions to spot fraud?
questionData.explanation: AI detects unusual spending patterns that may indicate fraudulent activity.

questionData.question: Which of these is a risk of deploying AI in real-world systems?
questionData.explanation: AI may inherit biases from training data, leading to unfair outcomes.
